ai.susi.mind

Class SusiIntent

  • java.lang.Object
    • ai.susi.mind.SusiIntent

  • public class SusiIntent
extends java.lang.Object
    An intent in the Susi AI framework is a collection of phrases, inference processes and actions that are applied on external sense data if the phrases identify that this intent set would be applicable on the sense data. A set of intent would is a intent on how to handle activities from the outside of the AI and react on such activities.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  SusiIntent.Score
      The score is used to prefer one intent over another if that other intent has a lower score.

    • Method Detail

      • getIntents

        public static java.util.List<SusiIntent> getIntents(JSONObject json,
                                                    java.io.File origin)
        Generate a set of intents from a single intent definition. This may be possible if the intent contains an 'options' object which creates a set of intents, one for each option. The options combine with one set of phrases
        Parameters:
        json - - a multi-intent definition
        Returns:
        a set of intents

      • getID

        public long getID()

      • getKeys

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getKeys()
        To simplify the check weather or not a intent could be applicable, a key set is provided which must match with input tokens literally. This key check prevents too large numbers of phrase checks thus increasing performance.
        Returns:
        the keys which must appear in an input to allow that this intent can be applied

      • getComment

        public java.lang.String getComment()
        An intent may have a comment which describes what the intent means. It never has any computational effect.
        Returns:
        the intent comment

      • getScore

        public SusiIntent.Score getScore()

      • getPhrases

        public java.util.List<SusiPhrase> getPhrases()
        The phrases of an intent are the matching intents which must apply to make it possible that the phrase is applied. This returns the phrases of the intent.
        Returns:
        the phrases of the intent. The intent fires if ANY of the phrases apply

      • getInferences

        public java.util.List<SusiInference> getInferences()
        The inferences of a intent are a set of operations that are applied if the intent is selected as response mechanism. The inferences are feeded by the matching parts of the phrases to have an initial data set. Inferences are lists because they represent a set of lambda operations on the data stream. The last Data set is the response. The stack of data sets which are computed during the inference processing is the thought argument, a list of thoughts in between of the inferences.
        Returns:
        the (ordered) list of inferences to be applied for this intent

      • getActionsClone

        public java.util.List<SusiAction> getActionsClone()
        Actions are operations that are activated when inferences terminate and something should be done with the result. Actions describe how data should be presented, i.e. painted in graphs or just answer lines. Because actions may get changed during computation, we return a clone here
        Returns:
        a list of possible actions. It might be possible to use only a subset, but it is recommended to activate all of them

      • matcher

        public java.util.Collection<java.util.regex.Matcher> matcher(java.lang.String s)
        The matcher of a intent is the result of the application of the intent's phrases, the pattern which allow to apply the intent
        Parameters:
        s - the string which should match
        Returns:
        a matcher on the intent phrases

      • consideration

        public SusiArgument consideration(java.lang.String query,
                                  SusiThought recall,
                                  SusiReader.Token token,
                                  SusiMind mind,
                                  java.lang.String client)
        If a intent is applied to an input stream, it must follow a specific process which is implemented in this consideration method. It is called a consideration in the context of an AI process which tries different procedures to get the optimum result, thus considering different intents.
        Parameters:
        query - the user input
        token - the key from the user query which matched the intent tokens (also considering category matching)
        Returns:
        the result of the application of the intent, a thought argument containing the thoughts which terminated into a final mindstate or NULL if the consideration should be rejected
